titleStmt.title: A practicall catechisme of purpose framed for the help of such as desire to enjoy more sweet and intimate soul-communion with Jesus Christ in that sacred ordinance of his own Supper. Begun at Newport-Pagnel in Buckinghamshire, revived at Luton in Bedfordshore, and now perfected at Queen Hithe in London. By Samuel Austin, an unworthy minister of the Gospell of Jesus Christ.
titleStmt.author: Austin, Samuel, Minister of St. Michael's Queenhithe.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Tho. Vnderhill, at the sign of the Bible in Woodstreet,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: A practicall catechisme concerning the Lords Supper.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the sign of the Bible in Woodstreet
